messages.content: ComfyUI_yanc is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI that includes some basic nodes that the creator finds useful and has created to meet their personal needs.
What is the purpose of the 'Rotate Image' node in ComfyUI_yanc?
The 'Rotate Image' node in ComfyUI_yanc rotates an image and outputs the rotated image and a mask, which can be combined with another image using the ImageCompositeMasked node.
How does the 'Load Image From Folder' node in ComfyUI_yanc work?

The 'Load Image From Folder' node in ComfyUI_yanc loads randomly or iteratively an image from a specified folder. If no folder is specified, it loads a random image from the 'input' directory. By connecting a primitive to the 'index' input, the node can iterate through images in the specified folder.
What is the function of the 'NIKSampler' node in ComfyUI_yanc?
The 'NIKSampler' node in ComfyUI_yanc is a sampling node that can be used in combination with the 'Noise From Image' node. A tutorial on its usage is available on the creator's YouTube channel.
What does the 'Light Source Mask' node in ComfyUI_yanc do?
The 'Light Source Mask' node in ComfyUI_yanc takes the brightest parts of an image (adjustable with a threshold) and creates a blurred mask.
What is the 'RGB Color' node in ComfyUI_yanc used for?
The 'RGB Color' node in ComfyUI_yanc is a helper node to create RGB colors. It outputs an INT value for the color as well as for each channel, and also exports the color in HEX format.
What post-processing options are available in ComfyUI_yanc?

ComfyUI_yanc offers various post-processing nodes such as Brightness, Contrast, Saturation, Sharpen, Divide Channels, Combine Channels, Edge Enhance, Bloom, Blur, Vignette, Fog, Scanlines, RGB Shift, Film Grain, HUE, and Lens Distortion.
